casebody.data:
SIMMONS v. STROMBERG-CARLSON TELEPHONE MFG. CO.† (Circuit Court of Appeals, Fifth Circuit. October 29, 1913.) No. 2468. Appeal from the District Court of the United States for the Northern District of Georgia; Wm. T. Newman, Judge. Suit in equity by the Stromberg-Carlson Telephone Manufacturing Company against C. Jerome Simmons. Decree for complainant, and defendant appeals. Affirmed. For opinion below, see 199 Fed. 256. James L. Anderson and Robt. C. Alston, both of Atlanta, Ga., for appellant. Orville A. Park, E. P. Johnston, and Geo. S. Jones, all of Macon, Ga., for appellee.

Before PARDEE and SHELBY, Circuit Judges, and FOSTER, District Judge.

PER CURIAM.

We have carefully examined the large record in this case in the light of the very able arguments and briefs submitted on hearing, and we conclude that the case was properly ruled and decided in the lower court The decree, therefore, should be and the same is hereby affirmed.
